DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication whether or not the adverse event is determined to be "serious" based on what is defined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Adverse Event Seriousness of Adverse Event
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._Clinical significance of adverse event defined based on the patient and event outcome or action criteria usually associated with events that pose a threat to a patient's life or functioning. Seriousness of adverse event serves as a primary guide for defining regulatory reporting obligations and changes in medicinal product development and usage.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An unwanted effect caused by a drug or therapy.  Such effects can be drug related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another drug, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ObjectClass.changeDescription: Change concept code to C41331 as C2861 is retired per EVS. dw

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Assess if an adverse event should be classified as serious based on the serious criteria defined in the protocol.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: This field is related to the individual serious adverse event type fields, which may or may not be collected on the CRF. Either AESER or all the Adverse Serious type fields must be present on the CRF. The sponsor should check if the regulatory agencies to which the data will be submitted require the collection of this data.

ReferenceDocuments.name: AESER
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.
